summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene and styrene-butadiene rubber are mentioned as pollutants linked to specific consumer products. 1,4-dichlorobenzene is associated with mothballs and room deodorizers, while styrene-butadiene rubber is linked to rubber products. Their relationship is primarily based on their commonality as pollutants from distinct sources rather than any direct chemical or functional interaction.
